title: The league launcher that doesn't.
body: So this morning I double click on my League of Legends desktop icon and am greeted in the launcher by a big heading reading "THE CLIENT UPDATE HAS BEGUN." I think to myself, "Yes, I downloaded that a while back, but have been running the legacy client just for performance reasons." Thinking nothing more of it and not bothering to read the blurb on the splash, I direct my cursor the the orange Launch button at the top of the window. As expected the launcher vanishes and I get myself into the typical waiting pattern of 3-5 seconds for the client login to appear. To my dismay, it did not. I tried again, again and again, each to no avail. My theory is that somewhere in the inner workings of this launcher, is an option to launch the now decommissioned legacy client and not the new updated version, however any option to rectify this is not visible to me. I was playing just hours ago and now I am not. halp plz

replies.body:
I am also having this problem.
Had to do a fresh install, and now clicking launch just closes the launcher.

Update: You can launch the new client directly!
This is where I found mine - C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\league_client\releases\0.0.0.61\deploy\LeagueClient.exe

Then when it is launched, it will update your shortcuts to this for you
I also am having this problem, The Legacy client is my friend, and i want it back, the new client freezes on 28 seconds in champ select, someone pls help SOS
